questions.prompt_md: 26. Kormilda College opened as a school in ..............................

27. At the time of writing there were .............................. non-aboriginal students at Kormilda College. Question 28 From the list below, choose the best heading for Section B of the reading passage. Write the appropriate letter A-D in box 28 on pour answer sheet. A Specialist teaching and teachers at Kormilda College B Special Programmes at Kormilda College for Aboriginal students C The new look Kormilda College D Programmes at Kormilda College to promote individual excellence

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

34. Kormilda College educates both Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal students.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

35. Some students travel from Arnhem Land to attend Kormilda College.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

36. Students must study both the International Baccalaureate and Northern Territory courses.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

37. The Pre-Secondary School attracts the best teachers.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

38. The specialist curriculum Support Unit adapts school courses so the students can approach them more easily.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

39. There are no oral traditional stories in Western communities.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

40. The school helps the students make connections between Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal cultures.
